channel.title: black museum
channel.itunes:author: www.botar.us
channel.description:
Opening in 1875, the Crime Museum at Scotland Yard is the oldest museum in the world purely for recording crime. The name Black Museum was coined in 1877 by a reporter from The Observer, a London newspaper, although the museum is still referred to as the Crime Museum. The idea of a crime museum was conceived by Inspector Neame who had already collected together a number of items, with the intention of giving police officers practical instruction on how to detect and prevent burglary. It is this museum that inspired the Black Musuem radio series.
The museum is not open to members of the public but is now used as a lecture theatre for the curator to lecture police and like bodies in subjects such as Forensic Science, Pathology, Law and Investigative Techniques. A number of famous people have visited the musuem including Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, Harry Houdini, Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy.
channel.itunes:subtitle: black musuem
channel.itunes:summary:

The idea of a crime museum was conceived by Inspector Neame who had already collected together a number of items, with the intention of giving police officers practical instruction on how to detect and prevent burglary. It is this museum that inspired the Black Musuem radio series.
The museum is not open to members of the public but is now used as a lecture theatre for the curator to lecture police and like bodies in subjects such as Forensic Science, Pathology, Law and Investigative Techniques. A number of famous people have visited the musuem including Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, Harry Houdini, Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy.

item.title: .22 caliber pistol - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Little Blue .22. It appears that a high society woman had killed her boyfriend in a jealous rage. But when it comes to trial, the case turns out to be not as airtight as first thought.

item.title: .32 caliber bullet - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Center Fire Bullet. Scotland Yard investigates the botched robbery of a jewelry store where someone was shot. Although they've managed to get a good idea of who did it, it'll be tough to get it to stick unless they find the weapons used in the robbery.

item.title: bath tub - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Bathtub. A man who secretly has multiple wives in different towns decides to thin out the harem and collect on the insurance policies by drowning them in their baths.

item.title: black gladstone bag - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Gladstone Bag. A married man who has been seeing another woman is losing interest in her, so he hacks her up at an isolated beach house.

item.title: bloodstained brick bat - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Brick Bat. The much older husband of a woman is found near death with his head smashed in. The prime suspect is the youthful gardener with whom she might have been a bit too friendly with.

item.title: brass button - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Brass Button. A reclusive artist is found strangled and the only hint as to who did it comes from the brass button found nearby that is the kind found on Army uniforms.

item.title: can of weedkiller - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary:
Opening in 1875, the Crime Museum at Scotland Yard is the oldest museum in the world purely for recording crime. The name Black Museum was coined in 1877 by a reporter from The Observer, a London newspaper, although the museum is still referred to as the Crime Museum. The idea of a crime museum was conceived by Inspector Neame who had already collected together a number of items, with the intention of giving police officers practical instruction on how to detect and prevent burglary. It is this museum that inspired the Black Musuem radio series.
The museum is not open to members of the public but is now used as a lecture theatre for the curator to lecture police and like bodies in subjects such as Forensic Science, Pathology, Law and Investigative Techniques. A number of famous people have visited the musuem including Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, Harry Houdini, Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy.

item.title: canvas bag - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Canvas Bag. The body of a young woman is found hacked up and stuffed in a canvas sack from a local grocery warehouse. The police must now comb through hundreds of missing person reports to find out who the victim was.

item.title: car tire - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Car Tire. Two thieves break into a garage and steal the new Evans inside. While driving off into the night, they get pulled over for speeding. Unable to prove ownership of the vehicle, they resort to shooting the unsuspecting constable.

item.title: champagne glass - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Champagne Glass. A colonel's wife dies from what seems to be stomach trouble shortly after returning from a sanitarium. Suspicion is aroused when one of his creditors receives a box of candies from him that an analysis reveals contains arsenic.

item.title: claw hammer - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: The Hammer. A fellow posing as a repairman kills an elderly woman living alone and ransacks her house.

item.title: faded tartan scarf - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Faded Tartan Scarf. A professional criminal who specialized in burglaries and car thefts finds himself a bit out of his league when he kills the driver of a postal truck he had been attempting to hijack.

item.title: four small bottles - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Four Small Bottles. A woman is weary of being stuck with her much older husband. So she has had purchased some chloroform, allegedly to administer to him as a painkiller for his stomach trouble.

item.title: french english dictionary - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: French English Dictionary. A Frenchman with poor English is staying at an inn where he becomes infatuated with the landlords wife. After a while, the landlord dies from what the doctor later determines to be strychnine poisoning

item.title: gas receipt - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Gas Receipt. A constable pulls over a speeding car that was stolen and gets shot almost immediately. The superstitious perp also shoots out both eyes, believing itll keep him from getting identified..

item.title: glass shards - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Glass Shards. A man returns home to find a burglar ransacking the place. He then attempts to take on the burglar on his own, not realizing that he is armed.

item.title: hammerhead - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Hammerhead. The search for a missing person dredges up a murder. The victims petty crook husband seems the most likely suspect, but he denies it and the case against him is not strong enough to go to court.

item.title: jack handle - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Jack Handle. In London during the Blackout, a U.S. Army deserter and his girlfriend go about robbing and assaulting people in the street for thrills.

item.title: jar of acid - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Jar of Acic. A woman staying at a hotel with a friend is concerned when said friend seemingly disappears without a trace after going out with the charming man they had recently met.

item.title: khaki handerchief - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Khaki Handerchief. After an extensive search, a missing woman is found murdered in the countryside outside the village she lives. Some physical evidence left behind suggest that the killer was from a nearby army camp.

item.title: ladys shoe - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: ladys shoe. The recent marriage of a middle-aged couple is starting to show some strain when the husband starts harassing the maid and making large withdrawals from their joint account. The wife states her intentions of seeing her solicitor in London, but she then vanishes without a trace shortly thereafter.

item.title: leather bag - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Leather Bag. A payroll clerk is found murdered with the payroll cash he was carrying gone. The police manage to build a strong circumstantial case, but there are still a few bothersome incomplete details.

item.title: letter - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Letter. An unknown person is writing near perfect check forgeries and having dupes cash them so as to make it more difficult to trace.

item.title: mandolin string - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Mandolin String. A womans husband dies when he falls down the basement steps. When her second husband dies in the same manner, a neighbor gets suspicious and sends an anonymous letter to Scotland Yard.

item.title: meat juice - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Meat Juice. In 1892, the wife of a hypochondriac twice her age with whom relations have become strained plots to poison him by extracting arsenic from flypaper and putting it in one of his tonics.

item.title: notes - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Notes. Three murders have been committed, and the linking factors are that a note saying -Kilroy was here- was left at all three scenes and the victims had all associated with a copyright solicitor.

item.title: old wooden mallet - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Old Wooden Mallet. A flaming car is found with a body burnt beyond recognition. Tracking the license number, it is learned that the car belonged to a man with four wives, each in a different town.

item.title: open ended wrench - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Open Ended Wrench. A woman is found dead in a car wreck. What initially looks to be a case of drunk driving becomes murder when the coroner discovers bruise marks caused by a wrench.

item.title: pair of spectacles - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Pair of Spectacles. A city girl disappears in a suspicious manner when she visits the rather worthless chicken farmer she is in love with.

item.title: piece of iron chain - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Piece of Iron Chain. A young heiress has had an attempt on her life by someone pretending to be her fathers ghost. Naturally, the police suspect her next of kin, but discover that all three of them died within a few days of each other.

item.title: pink powder puff - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Pink Powder Puff. A murderer about to be executed recounts to the warden the deeds that led to his sentencing, as well as a couple that were never tied to him.

item.title: post card - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Post Card. When a man finds his recently wed wife in her bedroom with her head severed, the investigation reveals a double life she had been leading which may have been behind her death.

item.title: prescription - 1952
item.itunes:author: www.botar.us
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date 1952
item.itunes:summary: Prescription. A woman in long-term care decides to leave a sizable chunk of her estate to the nurse who has cared for her. Most curiously, her health then takes a turn for the worse.
